intro: Brassica oleracea var. praecox, commonly known as early cabbage, is a cool-season plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its compact, dense head of dark green leaves, which develop rapidly compared to other cabbage varieties. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in temperate climates with moderate temperatures. It is cultivated for its edible leaves and is often used in early spring harvests. The botanical features of this variety make it well-suited for short growing seasons and diverse soil conditions.
